body:
Yep, it fails. I'll do another round tomorrow.

On Mon, Feb 13, 2017, 8:04 PM apolcyn <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@apolcyn* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In tools/run_tests/run_microbenchmark.py
> <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/9699#pullrequestreview-21673462>:
>
> > @@ -133,11 +133,9 @@ def collect_perf(bm_name, args):
>                             'bins/mutrace/%s' % bm_name,
>                             '--benchmark_filter=^%s$' % line,
>                             '--benchmark_min_time=20'])
> -    with open('bm.perf', 'w') as f:
> -      f.write(subprocess.check_output(['sudo', 'perf', 'script', '-i', 'perf.data']))
> -    with open('bm.folded', 'w') as f:
> -      f.write(subprocess.check_output([
> -          '%s/stackcollapse-perf.pl
>
> ' % flamegraph_dir, 'bm.perf']))
> +    subprocess.check_call(['sudo', 'perf', 'script', '-i', 'perf.data', '>', 'bm.perf'], shell=True)
> +    subprocess.check_call([
> +        '%s/stackcollapse-perf.pl' % flamegraph_dir, 'bm.perf', '>', 'bm.folded'], shell=True)
>
> Actually AFAIK I don't think the python.sub_process recognizes this?
>
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you modified the open/close state.
